title: Effect of Exercise on Type 2 Diabetes: A Randomized Controlled Trial
abstract: Background: Physical activity is recommended for type 2 diabetes management. Methods: We conducted a randomized controlled trial of 200 adults with T2DM. Results: Exercise intervention reduced HbA1c by 0.8%. Conclusions: Exercise is effective for glycemic control.

title: Systematic Review of SGLT2 Inhibitors in Elderly Patients
abstract: Objective: To review the safety and efficacy of SGLT2 inhibitors in adults over 65. Methods: Systematic review of RCTs. Results: 15 studies met inclusion criteria. Conclusions: SGLT2 inhibitors are safe and effective in elderly patients.

title: Letter to Editor: Re: Diabetes Treatment Guidelines
abstract: I read with interest the recent article on guidelines...

title: Metformin vs Placebo in Pediatric Diabetes: A Randomized Trial
abstract: Background: Metformin is used off-label in children. Methods: RCT in 100 pediatric patients. Results: Significant improvement in glycemic control.

title: Pharmacotherapy for Type 2 Diabetes: A Meta-Analysis
abstract: Objective: To evaluate drug therapy options for T2DM. Methods: Meta-analysis of 50 RCTs. Results: Multiple agents showed efficacy. Conclusions: Individualized therapy is recommended.

title: Randomized Controlled Trial of GLP-1 Agonist in Adults with T2DM
abstract: Background: GLP-1 agonists show promise. Methods: Double-blind RCT in 300 adults. Results: Significant weight loss and HbA1c reduction.

title: Cluster Randomized Trial of Diabetes Education Program
abstract: Background: Education improves outcomes. Methods: Cluster RCT in 20 clinics. Results: Improved self-management in intervention group.
